summary: An internal FBI email from August 17, 2019, forwarding a request for assistance. The original request, dated August 16, 2019, indicates that the FBI New York team served 16 subpoenas as part of the Jeffrey Epstein death investigation and may need 10 people on standby to assist with interviews on the following Monday or Tuesday.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: The sender of the original email requesting assistance for the Epstein death investigation, based at the New York Field Office.

events.title: FBI Serves Subpoenas in Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: The FBI New York team served 16 subpoenas as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Planned Interview Support for Epstein Investigation
events.description: The FBI planned to have 10 people on standby to assist with interviews related to the Epstein death investigation, anticipated for Monday, August 19, 2019, and/or Tuesday, August 20, 2019.

keyFacts: The FBI served 16 subpoenas as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019.
The FBI New York team anticipated needing to conduct interviews and requested 10 people to be on standby for assistance.
The email correspondence highlights the active investigative steps taken by the FBI immediately following Epstein's death.
